summary_points: 1. Best Buy's fiscal year 2025 revenue decreased by 4.4% year-over-year to $41.5 billion, accompanied by a $475 million goodwill impairment charge related to Best Buy Health.
2. Best Buy plans to close 5-10 stores in its Domestic segment in fiscal year 2026.
3.  Best Buy expects to recognize $133 million in unrecognized compensation expense over the next 1.8 years related to non-vested time-based share awards.
1. Accenture's Q2 2025 revenue increased by 5% in USD (8.5% in local currency) compared to Q2 2024.
2.  Accenture faces material adverse effects from a data security lawsuit and a DOJ investigation into Accenture Federal Services, with undetermined costs and timing of resolution.
3. Accenture's non-current investments significantly increased to $441,720,000 as of February 28, 2025, from $334,664,000 as of August 31, 2024.
1. General Mills' net sales decreased 5% year-over-year in the third quarter of fiscal 2025 (ending February 23, 2025), primarily due to decreased volume.
2.  The company completed the sale of its Canadian yogurt business for a pre-tax gain of $95.9 million and acquired NX Pet Holding, Inc. for $1.4 billion in cash during the same period.
3. The pending sale of the U.S. yogurt business, with $730.2 million in assets and $20.5 million in liabilities as of February 23, 2025, is expected to impact future financial results.

1. Darden Restaurants' total sales increased by 6.2% year-over-year in the third quarter of fiscal year 2025, reaching $3.2 billion, driven by acquisitions and new restaurant openings, despite a modest 0.7% increase in same-restaurant sales.
2.  Adjusted diluted net earnings per share from continuing operations for Q3 FY25 was $2.80, a 6.9% increase year-over-year, excluding $0.06 per share in Chuy's transaction and integration costs.

3. Darden Restaurants updated its full-year fiscal 2025 financial outlook to include approximately $12.1 billion in total sales and adjusted diluted net earnings per share from continuing operations of $9.45 to $9.52,  excluding approximately $47 million in pre-tax Chuy's transaction and integration costs.
1. Accenture plc reported second-quarter fiscal 2025 revenues of $16.7 billion, a 5% increase in U.S. dollars and an 8.5% increase in local currency compared to the same period in 2024.
2.  As of March 20, 2025, Accenture narrowed its full-year fiscal 2025 revenue growth outlook to 5% to 7% in local currency,  predicting a negative 0.5% foreign exchange impact.
3.  Accenture's days sales outstanding (DSOs) increased to 48 days at February 28, 2025, from 43 days at February 29, 2024.
1. News Corp repurchased approximately US$650,499,333.65 worth of Class A and Class B shares as of March 19, 2025, under a US$1 billion stock repurchase program.
2.  On March 19, 2025, 21,283,564 Class A shares and 10,502,220 Class B shares were repurchased at prices ranging from US$14.88 to US$30.69 (Class A) and US$15.17 to US$35.25 (Class B).
3. News Corp's future share repurchases are subject to market conditions, the market price of the company's stock, and other factors, and there is no guarantee of further repurchases.

1. On March 17, 2025, Caesars Entertainment, Inc. appointed Jesse Lynn and Ted Papapostolou to its Board of Directors,  both designees of the Icahn Group,  following a Director Appointment and Nomination Agreement that includes standstill and voting commitments.

2.  The Icahn Group’s standstill restrictions on acquiring more than 5% of Caesars' outstanding common stock will remain in effect until at least 30 calendar days before the nomination deadline for the 2026 annual meeting of stockholders.

3. The agreement between Caesars and the Icahn Group requires the resignation of one or both Icahn designees from the Board if the Icahn Group's beneficial ownership falls below 10,551,100 or 5,275,550 shares of common stock, respectively (with adjustments for certain events).
1. FactSet's Q2 2025 GAAP revenues were $570.7 million, a 4.5% increase year-over-year, driven by growth from wealth and institutional buy-side clients.
2.  Organic ASV increased by $90.7 million year-over-year to $2,276.2 million (a 4.1% increase), while GAAP operating margin decreased by approximately 80 basis points year-over-year to 32.5%.

3. FactSet's updated fiscal 2025 guidance predicts organic ASV growth of $100 million to $130 million (approximately 4.4% to 5.8%), with GAAP diluted EPS expected to be in the range of $14.80 to $15.40 (down from the previous guidance of $15.10 to $15.70).

1. On March 19, 2025, Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd. completed exchange transactions of approximately $213 million in 6.000% Convertible Senior Notes due 2025 for approximately 3.3 million shares of common stock and $214 million in cash.
2.  The Exchange Transactions reduced Royal Caribbean's fully diluted outstanding shares by 1.0 million shares, leaving approximately $110 million in 2025 Notes outstanding as of March 19, 2025.

3. The issued shares were part of a private placement, exempt from registration under Section 4(a)(2) of the Securities Act of 1933, relying on representations that holders are accredited and qualified institutional buyers.

1. On March 18, 2025, Celanese Corporation announced early results and an upsize of cash tender offers to purchase up to €552,082,000 of its 4.777% Senior Notes due 2026 and up to $500,000,000 of its 6.415% Senior Notes due 2027.

2.  As of the early tender time on March 18, 2025, €552,082,000 of the 2026 notes and $1,354,646,000 of the 2027 notes were validly tendered, resulting in a pro-rata acceptance of the 2027 notes at a 36.40% rate.
3. Celanese expects to settle the tendered notes on March 21, 2025.
1. Quest Diagnostics' 2024 operating income increased by 11.1% year-over-year.
2. Project Nova, a $250-$310 million IT modernization initiative, is expected to generate $150-$200 million in annual cost savings by 2031, three years ahead of schedule.
3.  Quest Diagnostics projects a 4%-5% revenue CAGR and a 7%-9% adjusted EPS CAGR beyond 2025.
